com.github.glusk2.sprouts.core.comb

Interface Graph

  • All Superinterfaces:
    RenderBatch
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PresetGraph, TransformedGraph

    public interface Graph
extends RenderBatch
    A Graph is a combinatorial representation of a game of Sprouts.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<CompoundEdge> edgeFace(CompoundEdge edge)
      Returns the face in which edge lies.
      Set<CompoundEdge> edges()
      A set of LocalRotations CompoundEdges v, (a, b) of this Graph.
      List<Set<CompoundEdge>> faces()
      Returns the faces of this Graph.
      boolean isAliveSprout(Vertex vertex)
      Checks whether vertex is a living sprout connected to this Graph.
      Graph simplified()
      Returns a new graph without unneeded faces, vertices or edges.
      Graph splitEdge(CompoundEdge edge, Vertex vertex)
      Creates and returns a new graph that splits edge in two at the vertex.
      int vertexDegree(Vertex vertex, Color edgeColor)
      Returns the number of edgeColor edges that vertex is connected to in this Graph.
      Set<Vertex> vertices()
      Returns this Graph's Vertices.
      Graph with(Vertex origin, DirectedEdge direction)
      Returns a new Graph with an additional DirectedEdge.
      Graph without(Vertex origin, DirectedEdge direction)
      Returns a new Graph without a surplus DirectedEdge.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.github.glusk2.sprouts.core.util.RenderBatch

        render

    • Method Detail

      • faces

        List<Set<CompoundEdge>> faces()
        Returns the faces of this Graph.

        Each face is a Set of its bounding DirectedEdges.

        Returns:
        the list of bounding Sets of this Graph's faces

      • edges

        Set<CompoundEdge> edges()
        A set of LocalRotations CompoundEdges v, (a, b) of this Graph.

        Refer to LocalRotations interface definition for more info on notation used.

        Returns:
        the set of CompoundEdges v, (a, b)

      • vertices

        Set<Vertex> vertices()
        Returns this Graph's Vertices.
        Returns:
        the Set of Vertices in this Graph

      • with

        Graph with(Vertex origin,
           DirectedEdge direction)
        Returns a new Graph with an additional DirectedEdge.

        Refer to LocalRotations interface definition for notes on notation.

        Parameters:
        origin - the center Vertex v
        direction - the DirectedEdge (a, b)
        Returns:
        a new Graph with an additional DirectedEdge

      • without

        Graph without(Vertex origin,
              DirectedEdge direction)
        Returns a new Graph without a surplus DirectedEdge.

        Refer to LocalRotations interface definition for notes on notation.

        Parameters:
        origin - the center Vertex v
        direction - the DirectedEdge (a, b)
        Returns:
        a new Graph without a surplus DirectedEdge

      • edgeFace

        Set<CompoundEdge> edgeFace(CompoundEdge edge)
        Returns the face in which edge lies.

        Refer to LocalRotations interface definition for notes on notation.

        Parameters:
        edge - a CompoundEdge v, (a, b)
        Returns:
        the face in which edge lies

      • simplified

        Graph simplified()
        Returns a new graph without unneeded faces, vertices or edges.
        Returns:
        a simplified Graph

      • splitEdge

        Graph splitEdge(CompoundEdge edge,
                Vertex vertex)
        Creates and returns a new graph that splits edge in two at the vertex.
        Parameters:
        edge - the edge to split
        vertex - the splitting point
        Returns:
        new graph without edge

      • isAliveSprout

        boolean isAliveSprout(Vertex vertex)
        Checks whether vertex is a living sprout connected to this Graph.

        A sprout is said to be alive when it is connected to at most 3 Submove edges.

        Parameters:
        vertex - the Vertex to check
        Returns:
        true if vertex is a living sprout connected to this Graph

      • vertexDegree

        int vertexDegree(Vertex vertex,
                 Color edgeColor)
        Returns the number of edgeColor edges that vertex is connected to in this Graph.
        Parameters:
        vertex - the Vertex to look up the degree for
        edgeColor - the degree is computed by only considering edgeColor edges
        Returns:
        a negative integer, if vertex is not connected to this Graph, the number of edgeColor edges connected to vertex otherwise
